description: Construction of a two-storey building containing two x 1 bedroom self-contained flats in the west corner of the site, car parking (including formalising the car parking to provide 19 additional car parking spaces for the site) and landscaping.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: 632 LO 1 (Location Plan), 632 100 (Existing Site Plan), 632 101 (Existing Plans & Elevations), 632 1003 Rev C (Proposed Site Plan), 632 1001 Rev C (Proposed Plans & Elevations), 632 1004 B (Existing & Proposed Street Scenes), Parking Report ref: 11004 (Singleton Clamp dated 12.07.11), Tree Report ref: AP1216/R/(c)/ss (Bartlett Consulting dated 6.05.11), Planning Design & Access Statement (Jay Ashall Associates January 2011) and K&M Traffic Surveys dated 13/01/2011, received 14/01/2015.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1, 2.1 & 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the consolidated London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted plans details of hard and soft landscaping works, replacement tree planting (with a minimum of 6 replacement trees), boundary treatment and landscaping management shall be submitted to and approved in writing to the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. Hard and soft landscaping works and tree planting shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the development, or in accordance with the programme of works agreed in writing with the local planning authority.  Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  Reason: To ensure that the development contributes to its setting in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and community safety, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (g), 1.2(f), 2.1(c) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the consolidated London Plan (2015), and section 7 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Prior to the commencement of the development on the site, details of a site construction method statement and management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The method statement/management plan shall include the following:+ 	 -on-site construction worker parking. -anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site. -delivery times (staggered to avoid morning and afternoon school run peak periods)+ -site security -vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including sweep path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles will access and exit from the site -details as to the locations for the storage of building materials and construction debris. procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents. -details of on-site monitoring of tree protection measures by a suitably qualified arboriculturalist. -details of the route and depth of proposed underground services.   Such details shall be implemented, or phasing agreed in writing, prior to the commencement of works on site and thereafter retained for the duration of the works.  To ensure appropriate mitigation measures to protect the amenity of local residents and occupiers of the neighbouring sites, to ensure adequate highway and site safety and to prevent damage to surrounding buildings and structures, in accordance with the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 6.11, 6.13, 7.4, 7.5 and 7.15 of the consolidated London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The 23 car parking spaces, access and manoeuvring areas shown on the approved plans shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and access and shall not be used for any other purpose, unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking  within the site, in accordance with policies 6.9, 6.10 and 6.13 of The consolidated London Plan (2015). | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, the residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to the Lifetime Homes Standards.  Reason: To ensure that the development is accessible by all future occupiers, in accordance with policy 1.1 (h) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 3.5 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.2 of The London Plan (2015),  and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) | The refuse and recycling storage area as detailed on the submitted plans ref: 6321001C (Proposed Plans & Elevations), 6321003C (Proposed Site Plan), shall be provided on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and shall thereafter be permanently retained.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (2015) policy 5.16. | Details of site drainage shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved details unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority,   Reason: To prevent flooding elsewhere by ensuring that sufficient storage of surface flood water is provided and achieved with appropriate sustainable drainage techniques, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 5.12 of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 5.12 & 5.13 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The existing trees on the site (other than trees T8 - False Acacia, T14 - Rowan, and G19 - Norway Maple Group shown to be removed in the submitted Tree Report ref: AP1216/R/(c)/ss (Bartlett Consulting dated 6.05.11), shall not be lopped, felled or otherwise affected in any way (including raising or lowering soil levels under the crown spread of the trees) and no excavation shall be cut under the crown spread of the trees.  Reason: To safeguard the trees in the interest of visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4-7.5, and 7.21 of The London Plan (2015) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Details shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval before the development is commenced, for the insulation of the building envelope, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, which will achieve the internal criteria for sensitive rooms, as specified in Supplementary Planning Guidance 10.  The details should also include the provision of alternative means of ventilation in accordance with Authority's criteria.  The works should be completed before occupation and permanently retained thereafter.  Reason: To safeguard the future occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the Consolidated London Plan 2015, policies 1.1 of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013. | The development hereby approved shall comply with 'Secured by Design' standards.  Reason: To ensure that the development incorporates crime prevention measures to help prevent crime and disorder and to improve pedestrian accessibility in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7.3 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policy 7.3 of the London Plan (2015).
